Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: I need to analyze the event log provided and determine which cases violate the normative rules and which ones just fail the desiderata Let me start by understanding the problem step by step

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First Part 1 outlines the strict rules The process must follow a specific sequence Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation if approved Close Case The key constraints are the order of activities and certain conditional steps based on approval or rejection

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the key constraints Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision If approved Finalize Documentation before closing if rejected close without finalizing Violations include skipping steps changing order finalizing after rejection or closing without following the logic

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Part 2 is about desideratarecommended but not strict These include timely Credit Check within 24h informing applicant within 48h of decision and a Follow up Call before closing Missing these isnt a serious violation but suboptimal

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at the event log Case 1 Activities in order Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case All steps in order Approved so they finalized docs before closing No issues here So no normative violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Desiderata Lets check timestamps Credit Check was 30 minutes after application within 24h Inform Applicant was 2 hours after decision within 48h

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: No Follow up Call mentioned for Case 1 Wait in the log for Case 3 its noted that theres no Follow up Call But Case 1 doesnt have a Follow up Call either The desiderata says Follow up Call is encouraged but not required So missing it is a desideratum violation But maybe only Case 3 is mentioned as having no Follow up Call Wait looking at the log But according to desiderata performing a Follow up Call is encouraged but not required So all three cases lack it but since its only noted for Case3 in the log perhaps Cases1 and2 actually did have one Or maybe all three lack it but only Case3 is highlighted The problem statement says So regardless of being noted or not if theres no activity called Follow up Call in the log entries for a case before Close Case then they missed it Therefore all three cases failed to meet desideratum by skipping Follow up Calls

Name: Validation - PE
Text: But maybe I need to check each case step by step Now moving on to analyzing each case for normative violations first Starting with Case1 Sequence Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case This follows the correct order according to normative rules Approved so Finalize Documentation happens before closing No steps skipped or reversed So no normative violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Desiderata violations Lets check timing Credit Check happened on same day within 24 hours Inform Applicant was at 1300 same day well within the recommended 48 hours But no Follow up Call performed before closingsothats a desideratum violation So desiderata failures for case1 would be lack of follow up call

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now moving to Case2 Activities Application Received Risk Assessment without prior Credit Check Credit Check Loan Rejected Finalize Documentation Close Case Normative violations here are First activity after Application Received is Risk Assessment without Credit Check firstthis violates ordering rule that Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Then they do Credit Check after Risk Assessment which is out of orderso major violation here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Additionally after Loan Rejected they performed Finalize Documentation which is prohibited then closed the case So two normative violations here order of Credit CheckRisk Assessment reversed and finalizing docs after rejection

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Also checking if other steps are followed After Loan Decision Rejected comes Inform Applicant Looking at their activities Loan Decision Rejected at Jan11th 0930 next activity is Finalize Documentation at1000but wait where is Inform Applicant According to normative rules after Loan Decision must come Inform Applicant regardless of approval or rejection Therefore in this case2 they skipped Inform Applicant entirelyanother violation because skipping steps isnt allowed

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So multiple violations here for case2

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now moving on to case3 Activities Application Received Credit Check after two days Risk Assessment Loan Approved Inform Applicant two days later Finalize Documentation Close Case Check normative rules first Sequence order should be Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Finalize Docs Close since approved Lets see their order Yes The sequence order here follows which aligns with approved path No steps skipped or reversed here except timing issues which are part of desiderata not normative rules Therefore normative constraints are met for case3

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: however desiderata are violated due to delayed credit check 24h delayed informing 48h from decision and missing follow up call

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So summarizing part1 answers Case1 No violations Case2 Multiple violations Case3 No normative violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now part2 desiderata failures For each case identify if they failed any desiderata conditions even if they followed strict rules Case1 Only missing follow up call Case2 credit check happened within an hour meets the desideratum informing applicant wasnt done at all follow up call wasnt done so another desideratum failure Case3 Credit check happened more than24h violates timing recommendation Loan decision made jan14th12pm inform applicant jan16th15pmwhich is over two days later 51 hours exceeding recommended48h Also no followup callso three desideratum failures

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now possible interpretationsjustifications For example in case3 why were there delays Perhaps due to weekends or high workload Alternatively perhaps there were external factors For case2s credit check happening quickly despite process errors may indicate that while some steps were rushed or misordered other aspects were handled timely where possible But given that these are just recommendations such delays dont break rules just best practices

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Thus summarizing answers Part1 Violations Case2 violates multiple norms Part2 Desiderata failures All cases missed followup calls Cases3 also had delayed credit checks and delayed informing applicants beyond recommendations Case2s credit check was timely despite other issues Possible justifications could be operational delays or human error
